thread.title: NBA Season Preview: ESPN's Power Rankings for 2015-16
thread.title_full: NBA Season Preview: ESPN's Power Rankings for 2015-16 - ABC News

author: abcNEWS
title: NBA Season Preview: ESPN's Power Rankings for 2015-16
text:
The NBA season begins on Oct. 27! We're rolling out our Insider forecasts, two at a time, from now until Opening Night. We begin with the two teams projected to finish last in their respective conferences. Dig in!
No. 15: Philadelphia Trust the process! Philly ranked 13th on defense last season behind DPOY contender Nerlens Noel, whose 4.2 defensive win shares as a rookie was the best since Tim Duncan in '99. Now the hope is for rookie Jahlil Okafor (projected 17.1/ 11.1 per 36 minutes) to make a similar impact on offense. More good news: Head coach Brett Brown, formerly of the Spurs, has some experience with twin towers. -- Brad Doolittle
READ MORE
No. 15: Minnesota Minnesota has two cornerstones in ROY Andrew Wiggins and 2015 No. 1 pick Karl-Anthony Towns. Now if the Timberwolves just didn't have so many bricks. They shot just 46.1 percent on 2s and 33.2 percent on 3s while taking a NBA-low 17.9 percent of shots from beyond the arc. This season they project to make the fewest 3s again. As is often the case with this franchise, the offense again looks stone cold. -- Kevin Pelton
READ MORE
